intro: Licania montana, commonly known as the mountain licania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Licania montana is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
